body.name: Apevia SPIRIT600W Spirit 600W ATX Power Supply with Auto-Thermally Controlled 120mm Fan, 115/230V Switch, All Protections
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Apevia 600W Spirit ATX Gaming Power Supply with black sandblasted casing. Supports Dual/Quad/Multi-core CPUs. Supports single 12V output for higher power usage.
Connectors : 1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x 4+4pin 12V, 2 x PCI 6+2pin, 4 x SATA, 4 x Peripheral

The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on.
The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector.
The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector.

The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 329 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Apevia’s Spirit line of power supplies bring form and function to your system, providing high efficiency with a basic black look that fits ATX computer builds. It supports the modern 12v 2.3 power standard with a single 12V rail setup. Boasting a silent 120mm black fan, it keeps everything inside the system cool. Comes with enough cables to connect all the devices you might need. The ATX-SP700 power supply is perfect for mid-range builds for both business and gaming use. IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on. IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality + value
reviews.reviewText: Works great an even though its not a modular psu, it had everything needed even if you need 3 8pins for a gpu, has a mesh style cover over all black cables (no mustard + ketchup combo). For the price point its unbeatable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Installed it and worked perfect.High quality.Low noise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars worked perfect for #idgafgamingpc build. Plenty of power for a rx580 w/ i72600k Play BFV temp @81*F
reviews.reviewText: this worked perfect for the #idgafgamingpc build. GREAT for budget builds and newbs, or even pros..Plenty of power for a rx580 w/ i72600k Playin BFV..Runs the CASE AND CPU fans, MB, SMOOTH. been letting it run daily, for past months. So far so good.. PLENTY of extra cable, and plugs, for any type of connection.. what i like, Is i wont be afraid to cut the harnes ends shorter for the SDD/HDD supplys, since theres like 8x? and there 3ft long... (YOU COULD CUT HALF OF THE sdd/hdd supply CABLE OFF, but i like having the option if i need too use them too ie: power and extra case fan or 4x) Only problem is all wires are BLACK..SO if you wanta splice stuff, you mite wanta check with a voltmeter first..and label) Fits in fullsize case nice.. came with a supply cable. 120 ac US style plug.The fan, its quiet imho.. Its no louder then the RX580 GPU(while GPU at normal op temps 48% fan speed).. I can live with it.. Its not and annoying fan like the DELL i had..Doesnt seem too run that hot. Stays cool in a fullsize case.. I snagged mycooking temp from the kitchen i use for roasts.. An think at normal idle mode, not gaming,lslow easy games, my thermometer says The PSU Outlet air temp is about 81*F right below the PSU.CANT BEAT IT.. MAKE A GREAT PSU FOR A BENCH TESTER BUILD, OR BATTERY CHARGER, ALSO..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worked fine out of the box
reviews.reviewText: Wiring is clean and isn't too long. Just got done installing it and my only issue is that fan is a lot louder than my twice as expensive Thermaltake that died after 10 years. But so far so good for the price, I'll deal with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ok for what it is.
reviews.reviewText: At this price point, it does a good job. I used a power calculator when designing this PC, and determined I'd need a bit over 500w. I opted for this power supply. It's passed all the bench marking, and hasn't had any thermal issues. I've bought from this series of power supplies before, and I've been satisfied. I always oversize the power supply a bit for the project, and that's been a good strategy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best upgrade from a 300w power supply
reviews.reviewText: I got this to replace a failing 300w power supply with a grinding fan, definitely worth the money and its working great so far with no issues. Only issue i had was user error and plugged in a pcix 6+2 pin the the the 12v port when it needed the 4x4 pins, thankfully i was able to fix it. I wish the cable was longer for the 4x4 pin connector, but i managed to get it work with the case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Almost fried brand new pc
reviews.reviewText: I'm building a pc for my little brother so I got this for his system cause I thought I could save some money and it had good reviews. Well I put this sucker in the system, tried booting it up and first thing I noticed was no signal was being sent to the monitor. Didn't think anything of it cause sometimes it can take a minute or two for a new pc to boot up, so I decided to go into the kitchen while it tried to boot up but as soon as I turned around that bad boi popped like a balloon. Ran over to the system, everything was shut off and it smelled like my left nut. Luckily I have my own personal pc so I was able to connect my own power supply to the system to test that the parts were working and it booted up fine. But some people aren't so lucky and would probably be left thinking their pc is dead. It would have deserved 0 stars but since it was atleast decent enough to have safety measures in place to save the pc components I give it 1 star.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent PSU for low power budget gaming pc.
reviews.reviewText: I built a budget pc for my son with spare parts laying around, that consisted of an NVMe drive, 3 fans, B550M motherboard, RX6500XT, Ryzen 5 5600X and a strip of led lights. I didn’t want to stress this out, as I haven’t used a cheap PSU in 20 years. I’d like to point out, that this has cheap braided cable wraps over already black wires, which make things look a little less cheap and gives a slightly less cheap look. I did add some carbon fiber wrap on the PSU in the section seen through the window, so my pics are just to point out the black cabling.The fan in the power supply is inaudible over the already fairly quiet case fans. The Connectors on it feel a little brittle, but I personally didn’t have any problems with them cracking, while hooking anything up. Honestly, I recommend this. For a $35 PSU on a low budget gaming pc, that is barely getting used for an hour a day, 2-4 times per week, it has exceeded my expectations.
Great power supply had all power connections needed for a 8 pin gpu and everything works great

Not the most efficient and the power cable connection is sketchy, I’ve had it slip out during games a few times(I have had this PSU for several months now) but it works if you needa power supply on a really tight budget.Overall, nice ATX PSU, and it’s nice that it has 4+4 Pin CPU Power
If you're building a gamer I wouldn'trecommend these psu's.Tried one and within minutes could smell burning plastic.A psu is VERY important. Buy good quality 80 + Gold if you can afford it
Didn’t work on my computer. Don’t know
had it for a few months and it died already
